intro: Humulopsis, commonly known as the hop plant, is a member of the Cannabaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing growth habit and the production of cones, known as hop cones, which are used in brewing beer. The plant contains compounds such as lupulins, which contribute to the bitterness and aroma of beer. Humulopsis species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features include compound leaves and a complex reproductive system involving wind-pollinated flowers.
